basics.name: Kaouther Messaoud
basics.label: Researcher
basics.summary: I am a postdoctoral researcher in the VITA group at EPFL. My research interests include representation learning and multi-modality for autonomous driving.

experience.name: VITA Lab, EPFL (Switzerland) | Valeo AI
experience.position: Postdoctoral Researcher, Representation Learning, Multi-Modality and Generalization
experience.summary: Built SOTA transformer‑based frameworks for multi-modal motion prediction using representation learning; self-distillation and masked reconstruction and developed cross-domain generalization techniques, parameter efficient fine-tuning strategies, and robustness measures.

experience.name: ASTRA Lab, INRIA (Paris)
experience.position: Postdoctoral Researcher, Trajectory Prediction and Planning
experience.summary: Integrated spatio-temporal transformer models for trajectory prediction and planning in dynamic environments.

experience.name: LISA Lab, UCSD (USA)
experience.position: Visiting Researcher, Context-based Trajectory Prediction for Autonomous Driving
experience.summary: Proposed an approach using MHA and a joint representation of the static scene latent features and surrounding agents and Achieved second place in the nuScenes trajectory prediction challenge with the MHA-JAM model.

experience.name: RITS Lab, INRIA $|$ Sorbonne University
experience.position: Ph.D. Researcher, Attention-based Trajectory Prediction for Autonomous Driving
experience.summary: Explored fundamental challenges in deep learning-based motion prediction and interaction dynamics within complex environments, emphasizing multi-modal generation and physical feasibility.

education.institution: École Polytechnique de Tunisie, Top engineering school in Tunisia

awards.title: George N. Saridis Best Transactions Paper Award of The IEEE TIV

publications.name: PerReg+: Generalizable Trajectory Prediction using Representation Learning
publications.summary: Designed and implemented PerReg+, an advanced trajectory prediction model integrating Dual-Level Representation Learning with Self-Distillation and Masked Reconstruction to capture global context and granular details.

publications.name: UniTraj: Unified Framework for Cross-Dataset Prediction
publications.summary: UniTraj: a framework that harmonizes diverse datasets, models, and evaluation metrics. It benchmarked various prediction models across multiple autonomous vehicle datasets, providing critical performance insights on prediction models’ cross-dataset generalizability and dataset characteristics and achieved state-of-the-art results on the nuScenes dataset by enhancing data diversity and scalability.

publications.name: Forecast-PEFT: Efficient Fine-Tuning for Motion Prediction
publications.summary: Designed Forecast-PEFT, a fine-tuning strategy significantly reducing training costs by freezing most model parameters and leveraging prompts and adapters. Enhanced prediction accuracy by up to 9.6% compared to conventional methods, achieving state-of-the-art efficiency with only 17% of the trainable parameters.

publications.name: Manipulating Trajectory Prediction with Backdoors
publications.summary: Identified vulnerabilities in motion prediction models to backdoor attacks and developed a defense mechanism using social attention to detect and mitigate abnormal agent influence.

publications.name: Social-Transmotion: Multi-Modal Human Motion Prediction
publications.summary: Designed Social-Transmotion, a transformer-based model that integrates diverse multimodal visual cues and employed masking techniques to ensure robustness against missing cues and validated on multiple datasets.
